Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: Ducky93
Reviews.Content: Stayed over for one night In early September. There were three in our group but only wanted one room. The staff were quick to make up the room for a third person. The room was clean and had some nice features including the use of a laptop. We had an inward facing room and there was no view but the room was still light. All in all a good hotel would stay there again when vosoto

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: Stifmaister
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a minimal-modern design which gives it a technologic look. Maybe the dark hallway with blu/purple are not the best but the rooms are pretty. But the best thing is the position! right outside the hotel, turn right and there is propably the best shopping street of all Madrid, in less than 50 m you have Starbucks(so don't pay extra for breakfast in hotel!!!) and the Hard rock cafe(if you're a fan.......) plus shops of several international brands. o yeah don't forget that right in front of you there is a 5/6 flats mall... if you want to eat something tipycal you must walk a litlle bit... 15 mins of walking from S. Bernabeu and puerta del sol!

Reviews.Title: “Fun”
Reviews.Author: Giov63
Reviews.Content: Very fun, design and urban, with bathroom with transparent walls and blue lights under the beds. I wouldn't stay long with my family, because not very roomy and no privacy (bathrooms), but in couple or business trip it's fine. Good location, not noisy and nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid with my family”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A GOOD 5 nights stay in thishotel at the end. Wonderful location close to city center in an high streets barrio. Very calm and serviced surroundings, but a short way to Madrid movida. Room too small for a 2+2 persons family (docking bed it is a solution but it is not enough!). On our arrival at 3:00 PM room was not ready. They quickly arranged it but we had to wait half- an-hour. The romm then was a real "oven". I woud reccomend to ask for front street room instead of "rear-inside facing" room. Atmosphere alittle bit cold and dark (both at receptionist and along the room-corridors). Peculiar bath divided by an opaque mid high glass (might be embarrassing if room is occupied by not fully companionships guys).

Reviews.Title: “Nice trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gregory_Lena
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights, in double room. Positive; - Interesting interior design - Very nice and helpful stuff - Good location - Nice and quiet room, no noises from outside. Negative: - 100+ eur for a night and 16 eur for breakfast for person (if you want, we didn't try if it's any good) - Some minor flows in finishes in the room, like missing screw or not working lamp, but it could be just our room. - Not too big of a deal, but if you getting to/from airport by metro, you'll need to walk about 5 min to closest station. Overall I think I would stay there again, but would consider other options as well.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed expectations and great location.”
Reviews.Author: VKXAN
Reviews.Content: Having read a number of negative reviews I was slightly concerned in relation to my choice of hotel but we needed to stay in this district and the High Tech offered exceptional value. I can say the Hotel was perfect and while the interior design may not be up to everybody's taste, the High Tech sells its self on its unique offering and unique interior design!! so I cant understand why people complain. The room was very comfortable and functional and yes the design unusual - but that is the hotels unique selling point. It is a 4* offering and does exactly that. A Corte Ingles is just across the road and has a fantastic supermarket on the lower floor in case you need any emergency items. I could not fault the overall offering and having an internet enabled computer in the room was a nice added touch. A fantastic location and the Staff were very polite and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but this is not enough. Staff smiling but this is not enough.”
Reviews.Author: ArBy777
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a hotel of this chain a few hundred metres from this one and was very satisfied with it but this time we changed as we had our son and wanted a larger room and the other hotel did not have larger rooms. We took a Duplex Suite, though it was more a loft concept than a Duplex. We arrived at 1530 and the room was not ready, this happens many times as we have all done late checkouts and so we can understand this. We were told to wait 15 minutes, and many apologies were given. The apologies are nice, but they could have offered a drink (at least water and soft drinks or coffee while we waited). Within 1/2 hour the room was ready. I had read from the comments about the modern sense of lighting and visible bathroom set-up, so was not surprised, but still a few things were disappointing. Open bathroom with no doors, even for toilet area. This is strange. I have stayed in rooms with totally open bathrooms, but the toilet area has been divided and with a door system. Very minimalist bathroom, but a great drawback was that next to the washbasin there was very very limited space to put things (toothbrush, toothpaste etc). Excellent that there was a toilet down which helped to solve many problems. We had had a long trip so we all decided to go to the room early and get in bed and order food. We were told that as it was a Holiday (Easter Friday) that the limited menu was not fully available, so we ordered a chicken sandwich and a spanish omelette. The chicken sandwich had a terrible presentation, though the taste was acceptable. I decided no more room dinners. At night as many times when we travel with our son it was my turn to sleep on the sofa bed. This was far to hard for an adult to sleep in. Its meant to be a new hotel, but a lot of the furniture in the rooms and in the main restaurant (breakfast room) looks old! Great location, the staff is friendly, but the the hotel needs more to be a 4 star+.

Reviews.Title: “City Break with Children”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamNoisy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was only a 10 minute walk from Colon metro station and in a nice part of madrid close to retiro park. The hotel staff were very friendly when we arrived and although they didnt speak much English dealt with our check in very quickly. The family room we had was spacious and had 2 pull down bunk beds plus they brought a cot to the room within 5 minutes of getting to the room. The room itself had a laptop and an IPOD docking station all free of charge which was a really nice to have. The kids loved the space in the room and the funky blue lights. The bathroom was clean and stocked with toiletries for us and the shower was great. The hotel was quiet and within easy reach of everything we needed and wanted to see, we would definitely use this hotel again when visiting Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Not only for Sci-Fi lovers...”
Reviews.Author: Justicia_Croft
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located for my business purposes, but a bit off from central tourist attractions and city center. However there’s a Corte Ingles around the corner and the posh luxury shopping street just ahead. Tube is anyway nearby, or just walk 20 mins to Sol. DECO: As to the hotel, it’s very modern interior and might not be everybody’s taste. The reception is standard modern flair and not that fancy. The floors however are dark, dim and just poorly lit by indirect light. Kind of Sci-Fi spaceship flair, which I personally adore. The spacious rooms are also kept in dark/grey fabrics, modern furniture and translucent material with indirect lightning (e.g. blue lights under the bed). The bathroom is a state of the art mini wellness area, and only separated from the main room by a glass wall with classy nude motive on it. Good selection of international TV channels and free Wifi. Always clean and good bedding. SERVICE: Sometimes the staff is a bit tight on English, but they are always keen to help you in their charming spanglish way (something you wont find that much as soon as you leave the hotel). Professional luggage storage system if early check-in or for the check-out day. Average sized breakfast buffet of good quality. Rate was always around 125 and I'm happy to pay it. It's my fav hotel in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Short break madrid”
Reviews.Author: Dazzascott
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel great, from the self service breakfast to the hotels position. Ideal for a short break. 5 stars from us.

Reviews.Title: “Different from the usual business hotel”
Reviews.Author: beautytravelerLondon
Reviews.Content: Interesting interior design, a nice difference from the usual business hotels. Friendliness at reception was non-existent (asked for an iron he got one and handed both the board and the iron to me despite the fact I also had my luggage to carry). The room was small but ok, although the dark brown wood panelling didn't do anything to lift the mood. Nice bathroom. But I really dont understand why they put a laptop i every room - who travels without their own computer these days?

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Vilada
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in the "Barrio de Salamanca". Great place for shopping and big choice of restaurants around it. Every rooms has a lab top and wifi free of charge. The decoration is quite funny. Clean. We have got an inside room which us very silent. Only issues: breakfast is very expensive and we got a room in smoking floor while we had booked a non smoking. Service in reception and restaurant: average.

Reviews.Title: “Functional for a short trip, but some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: Plus points first, well located near the business district, metro etc. Service OK, as clean and secure as you'd expect. Fine for a short business trip - functional but with some strange touches. Buffet breakfast was adequate but nothing to get excited about. The negatives. My room was a twin with two single beds - the beds were very narrow and had very thin mattresses, not particularly comfortable. The ensuite bathroom had glass walls, some privacy due to etched glass but essential see through - fine for me as I was the only one in the room but strange if it was being used as a twin.Corridors are dark lit with low blue lights, I think this was meant to look designer but the overall impression is of gloom. Communal areas limited and not very inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy & Fit for purpose”
Reviews.Author: IdRatherBeAtHome
Reviews.Content: A really swanky modern luminously lit in purple mood lights hotel. Had one morning where the hot water system went belly up and so it was a cold shower and shave, and in 10 degree temps, this was not ideal, but all guests were effected. An apology letter in our room would have made all the differnec to consider the impact of guests. I also had a chocolate in the minibar fridge that was 3 weeks out of date. I only found this out after opening it and seeing what was inside, this is not the best . For the corprate agreed price and location to my office in Madrid at 45 Serrano, it is well located and has excellent access to all the stores, restaurants and the metro is a couple of blocks away. The bed was comfy, the bathroom interesting with a massive embedded etched nude pic of a female and male body in the bathroom glass - not what I wouldconsider to be minimalistic or avante garde, you had no option but to wonder what the interior designer was thinking when this went in the plans. The breakfast was also suitable, but in B1 it had no natural light. Id stay again for the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Blue light and brothel like!”
Reviews.Author: Spanish_Tutor
Reviews.Content: The most stand out feature of this hotel is the eerie blue lights in the corridors and bedrooms. This weird lighting made the hotel feel more like a brothel than a four star hotel. Well located if you want to stay in the business district but it doesn't have much else going for it. The bed was easily the most uncomfortably I have ever slept in. There air con in the rooms only works when you have the door card in the frame so everytime I came back into the room it was like an inferno. The service was also slow checking in, I had to wait more than 20 minutes as there was only one person on the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: flapydog
Reviews.Content: Room are nice but corridors dark, close to metro station

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but”
Reviews.Author: Eloy58
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located, close to the nicest & expensive shopping area in Madrid but I don't think it deserves 4 stars. The room was quite spacious and it has a laptop with free wi-fi. We did not try the breakfast because in the "calle Serrano" there is a "Pain Quotidien", it has a good choice of breads.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, sexist, and suitable for business/shopping”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanDiversity
Reviews.Content: Catholic Spain has come a long way in becoming open-minded and relaxed about many things. But would you expect a regular, more business-focused hotel to decorate each bathroom – the shower actually – with the full-sized (!) silhouette of a naked woman? It is – or least was – the case at the High Tech President Castellana end of 2009. This detail was discussed quite at bit in our international group of business people, and you can imagine how the perspective changes with gender, cultural background, age, sexual orientation or religion! The decoration also was not included inadvertently but as part of a full re-design of the complete hotel in 2005. All rooms, the lobby and the meetings facilities boast a very cool, clean style, and all is good quality. However, the guest rooms are quite small (and a bit dark, even on the upper floors) and breakfast did not leave a strong impression either. Staff is friendly and helpful. The location is good for shopping and some sight-seeing as the hotel sits in a small side street just off Castellana and Serrano. This said, it’s obvious that the location is not so ideal if you want to discover the city or go out partying.

Reviews.Title: “Mid-size hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: AyseA
Reviews.Content: Location is great. It's a small hotel with very good guest service. The reception staff were very helpful. Bathrooms are clean. My double bed-room was looking at the interior and pretty small, but with interior lighting and the light coming from the bathroom, it did not seem that small. The reason why I gave a 3-star rating to sleep quality is because of the noise of non-ending road work that has been going on in Serrano and Paseo de la Castellana. I will definetely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: essexyid
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend the hotel is modern and in retro style very clean. A 20 min stroll to the main plaza area.Good breakfast at hotel either continental or English breakfast(Egg bacon etc),Rooms very big and clean massive bed good air con mini bar rather expensive.A 30min walk to Real Madrid stadium well worth visit very easy access to metro via Serrano Station 5 min away.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but bizarre”
Reviews.Author: Christofofofof
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for my work, but seemingly devoid of any restaurants / nightlife in the evening. Room was comfortable, nice bed, it did feel like too much had been wasted on gimmicks though. The hotel corridors were pitch black, with weird blue LED under lighting. The room had a glass walled bathroom, with optional blind, iPod dock, laptop provided (just remove the ethernet cable and use on your own laptop rather than use wireless), LCD etc. All mod cons were indeed provided. For some reason though the hotel's designers also though that blue LED lighting under the bed and the mirrors was also a good idea, I'm guessing the designer had once owned a Ford Escort with a similar concept. Overall it was a pleasant enough night's sleep, can't comment on breakfast. Did have to wait 20 mins for bar service though & the reception seemed a bit chaotic: overworked staff & printers not working etc.

Reviews.Title: “How on earth did this hotel achieve 4 stars?”
Reviews.Author: poncina
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrible! I was there with work – 28 people. Firstly we didn’t get the conference room we had booked, because a larger group came along and their opinion was that our group could better fit in the smaller room - can you believe it? most of the front staff was incredibly rude. The second day, there was only cold water in hotel – we all woke up at least. Good thing because the coffee was really poor. My dry cleaning was not ready within the 12 hrs as promised – when I mentioned that I didn’t have anything to wear the day after, I was told that I should probably have mentioned earlier to make sure it would be ready ?!?! I´ve never had such a HORRIBLE hotel experience. The bathroom was dirty – I noticed that my feet became dark walking on the floor – but honestly I didn’t want to ask the staff for more so I cleaned the bathroom myself. Since I was at it I removed the dust from the room as well. I have many more examples of the so called service at the hotel – but I think I have made myself pretty clear..try to find somewhere else :-)

Reviews.Title: “High Tech President Calle Villmagna”
Reviews.Author: happy1973
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights from the the 31st May. Reception are friendly but location is bad away from the real action of Madrid. This hotel is supposed to be 4 star. Room was small. Just nothing special about this hotel at all. Not worth the rating of 4 star. Modern but no character. Shop around there must be better out there.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel for good price”
Reviews.Author: Mooles
Reviews.Content: You'll get an excellent feel for this hotel from the stuff already written about it. I'd agree with just about everything. The hotel is clean, smart, with good staff and a good location. If I was staying with a group of friends and sharing / or on my first trip away with a new partner then I think I would stay somewhere else due to the bathrooms being rather 'open'! However, staying with my long-term partner there is no embarrassment factor and infact it was a brilliant hotel and good value for money. Standard rooms ok sized and aircon (in summer months). Didn't get breakfast at the hotel so couldn't comment. However, there are plenty of places to get a good value breakfast. Hotel is a 5 min walk from the nearest metro, and it costs 1 euro per trip. Well worth getting one of the multi-trip offers for around 6.50 euro for 10 trips if staying at this hotel as you probably will use the metro more often than you think.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it, great location”
Reviews.Author: vivafatelvis
Reviews.Content: A nice modern hotel, well thought out design with friendly staff. The complimentary bottle of cava was nice touch For the price you really can't fault this place especially its proximity to Serrano and the great shops. I've heard good things about the other Petit Palace and High Tech hotels too. The only minor gripe I had was some of the fixtures in the room were a little worn and the room service menu seemed to be a bit thin on what they actually had in stock, but then you can pop out and get some wonderful food and drink in this great city any time!.

Reviews.Title: “Try and get the Suite rooms”
Reviews.Author: sb5000
Reviews.Content: I've stayed three times at this hotel and it was always very nice. My only complaint is that the rooms seem to be a little over heated and I always need to open the windows to cool the room off a bit. The suite rooms are by far the best. The one I had was a duplex and it had a conference room with an exercise bike on the bottom floor. The last time I stayed in a High Tech room which is the same as the standard rooms except that they have a laptop computer in the room. The breakfast was really nice with a nice selection and there are several nice restaurants and a department store nearby. The hotel has free internet access with Wi-Fi and Ethernet however the speed is not fast enough for VOIP communication.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Lying Scam Hotel, Everything Went Wrong”
Reviews.Author: nascargrl24
Reviews.Content: STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!! This hotel was horrible! I booked a family room with breakfast included and had a confirmation number, then the night before we left the USA, I got an email saying they couldn´t give us a family room anymore, but they´d give us two double rooms at the same rate including breakfast since we had three people. When we checked in, the front staff was rude and they also said we didn´t have a reservation. I brought a copy of my email and they said they would not accept it. They said there was only one room in the hotel and it was a double. I said that was fine if we got it for the same rate as our original reservation. They said NO and we would have to pay the full rate and we would not get breakfast. We did not know what else to do or where else to go. We felt we had no other choice since I was with my grandparents and they were tired. So we got a double room and I had to SLEEP ON THE FLOOR. They wouldn´t even give me an extra blanket or towels. The front hotel was just RUDE and said we could go to another High Tech Hotel but that it would cost a lot more. They simply DID NOT CARE. I´ve stayed in Madrid a handful of times and have never had such a HORRIBLE experience. Then, the internet in the room DID NOT WORK and they wouldn´t bother fixing it for us! On top of that, the beds are SUPER HARD and the room was a lot SMALLER than the pictures looked. The water in the room was warm, but not hot. The towels are CHEAP and smelled bad. The hallways SMELLED BAD. The location was NOT AS GOOD as everything made it appear. It¨s a FAR WALK from the metro station if you are carrying bags and it´s slightly up a hill. The hotel visually looked really cool and modernistic, but everything was super uncomfortable. I wouldn´t even recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and in a posh side”
Reviews.Author: Poletino
Reviews.Content: Me nad my family stayed there over new year 2006/2007. It is very clean. The restaurant is expensive but there is a supermarket round the corner. I liked the fact that is situated away from the action of Del Sol. Posh shops are next street away. There is not much going on in the hotel but for me it did the trick as it was very clean. Staff was helpful. U can walk a bit to Del SOl but the bus stop is just there. They have 2 computers in the lobby that u can use.The lift broke down and was repaired in no time.The hotel is almost opposite El Corte. If u r lucky enough u can bump into Posh Spice shopping next street. . We booked a room for a family of 4 but had our 3 year old as the 5th guest. U cannot really ask for much. The hallway leading to bedrooms could do with more light. Definitely recommend it and I would go back there. We were given small hampers on new year eve. It would be complete and excellent if breakfast is included. If u are expecting a visitor to come to your room, have your shower and other business as the doors of the bathroom are transparent glasses.

Reviews.Title: “Long Stay Review”
Reviews.Author: 30Countrytraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for almost 20 consecutive nights. Why did i chose this hotel to stay ? 1.-I believe it is a good option if you are tired of traveling to Europe and staying in "Historic" "Traditional" hotels that smell old , have Luis XVI Style-unconfortable furniture, and ipod sized tv´s. 2.-The free internet access from the room works great, not like in other hotels where the network stops suddenly or works slowly . frequently in your room via LAN or WI FI , 3.-The LCD tv´s are also a Plus. 4.-For travelers that like working out , this hotel is also a very good choice because of its location 800 m away from "El Retiro Park" where you can see a lot of Runners, Cyclists, Rowers and Skaters early in the morning til late in the afternoon. 5.-Convenience Right Across the street you can find a "Corte Ingles" Store that has , in the basement , a supermarket section where you can buy Groceries in case you are tired of the multiple amount of restaurants available nearby. Cons: 1.-Room Service In my opinion too expensive (12 Euros for a Ham and Cheese Sandwich!) 2.-Breakfast Buffet is mediocre. 3.- Sometimes the cards used as keys are erased too easily. 4.- I believe the rooms are not suitable for kids (due to the naked-lady siluette/picture in the Glass Door of the Bathroom) I believe this hotel is a great option (a lot of Bang for the Buck), and i would stay without hesitation here again.

Reviews.Title: “hmmmm...Definitely go for the rooms with terraces”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: By the way the rooms with terraces are 610 and 611. I went for 609 and it was the "tv on desk with no workspace" variety. Also bear in mind that all the rooms on the 6th floor are smoking rooms. Although the ones with terraces don't stink of stale smoke, the other ones on that floor do. All in all quite a pleasant experience, however, think twice and have a good reason for changing room as you may be met with a fairly hostile staff at reception, as I was. On the one hand a cool, trendy place to stay but on the other could also be viewed as slanting towards the male customer - "stylish" pictures of naked women printed on the shower screens and most of the furniture could be found in a batchelor pad, let alone the suited and booted clientele. Lastly, for those of you who like sunlight you could probably find a better place to stay as it goes for the space ship neon light look which in my opinion tries a bit too hard.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel: good price and quality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed already various times in this hotel that was opened at the end of 2005. The interior is very trendy, clean, quiet and the hotel is situated in the heart of the business district of Madrid (Salamanca). Business people that do not want to spend time in boring, old fashioned hotels and that do not want to pay too much for high quality hotels, defenitely need to see this hotel. The Hi Tech hotel group has several hotels throughout Madrid, but this new hotel is defenitely above the standard of the other HT hotels in town.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic design”
Reviews.Author: EEYORETIGGERR
Reviews.Content: This is a very trendy boutique hotel, and the rooms are very impressive and well designed with a laptop and free wifi. I stayed here for 5 nights for a training seminar and we used the conference facilities throughout the week, which are pretty standard (not as high tech as the rest of the hotel.) The hotel is well located for the designer shops of Serrano however you will need to use the near by metro to access the more touristy areas. The main drawback of this hotel is the fact that it has no pool or gym, so I would advice that this hotel is best for a short stay.

HotelInfo.Name: High Tech President Castellana
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Marques de Villamagna 4, 28001 Madrid, Spain
